senses.de: Usually found in a certain situation, normal or common
senses.ex: She responded with her typical charm.

Tips.title: Expectation setting
Tips.description: Used when discussing what is considered usual or anticipated in situations.
Tips.example: He arrived late, which is typical for him.

Tips.title: Negative undertone
Tips.description: Sometimes has a negative connotation, implying dissatisfaction with the norm.
Tips.example: She gave a typical excuse for her absence.

Tips.title: Cultural implications
Tips.description: Can refer to behaviors or patterns commonly associated with particular cultures.
Tips.example: The fiesta was filled with typical Spanish festivities.

senses.de: Showing the characteristics expected or common for something or someone
senses.ex: A typical day for me begins at 7am.

Tips.title: Daily routines
Tips.description: Often relates to everyday habits or schedules for individuals or groups.
Tips.example: A typical morning in our house is very hectic.

Tips.title: Characteristic emphasis
Tips.description: Emphasizes common traits that define a person, group, or object.
Tips.example: Wearing bold colors is typical of his fashion sense.

Tips.title: Comparison
Tips.description: Useful when comparing specific subjects to the general standards or norms.
Tips.example: Compared to her earlier work, this painting is not at all typical.

senses.de: Serving as a representative example of a class or group
senses.ex: The car is a typical example of luxury.

Tips.title: Exemplification
Tips.description: Highlights something as a model which perfectly represents a larger group or category.
Tips.example: That speech was a typical example of his eloquence.

Tips.title: Scientific contexts
Tips.description: In research, denotes a sample or result that reflects the average or expected outcome.
Tips.example: The experiment yielded typical results for this chemical reaction.

Tips.title: Avoid stereotypes
Tips.description: Be mindful not to use 'typical' in a way that unfairly stereotypes groups of people.
Tips.example: Saying she's good at math because she's Asian is using a typical stereotype.

Average.wordDefinition:
Average refers to the calculated sum of data divided by the number of items. For example, if you have a class of 20 students and their ages are 10, 11, 12, 13 and so on up to 29, then the average age of the class can be calculated as (10+11+12+...+29)/20, which is 19.5.

In essence, average is a mathematical term used to describe the mean of a set of data, while typical is a more general word used to describe what is commonly expected or experienced.

Common.wordDefinition:
Common refers to something that is frequent or widely known or used.

It can describe things that are ordinary or general, like a common cold.

In simpler terms, common means it happens a lot or is well known, while typical means it's normal or expected based on what we already know.

Conventional.wordDefinition:
Conventional refers to something that is accepted or done in a traditional way, often based on social norms or expectations.

For example, a conventional wedding might include a white dress, a church ceremony, and exchanging rings.

Conventional refers to something that is traditional or based on social norms, while typical refers to something that is common or expected in a given situation.

Expect.wordDefinition:
Expect means to anticipate or to have a belief that something will happen or be true. For example, "I expect my package to arrive tomorrow.".

In simpler terms, expect is used when someone thinks something will happen, while typical is used when something is common or usual for a particular situation or group.

Normal.wordDefinition:
Normal refers to something that is usual or expected in a particular situation. For example, it's normal for people to wear clothes when they go out in public.

Normal is used when talking about expected behavior or events, while typical is used when talking about things that are characteristic of a group or situation.

Ordinary.wordDefinition:
Ordinary means something that is common, everyday or usual. For example, an ordinary day would be a regular day that is nothing special.

Typical means something that is representative or characteristic of a particular group or category. For example, a typical day would be a day that is similar to most other days, with nothing out of the ordinary happening.

Ordinary is a more general term and can describe anything that is plain or unremarkable.

Regular.wordDefinition:
Regular refers to something that is done or happens on a consistent basis, such as a routine or schedule.

Regular describes the frequency or pattern of something while typical describes the general expectation or norm.

So, for example, a person's regular exercise routine might involve running three times a week, while it is typical for students to take exams at the end of each semester.

Standard.wordDefinition:
Standard refers to a set of rules or guidelines that are generally accepted and followed by a group of people.

For example, standard measurements like inches or meters are used around the world to ensure consistency and accuracy.

Standard relates to a rule or measure, while typical relates to a common situation or behavior.

Usual.wordDefinition:
Typical and usual are similar words that mean similar things, but there is a slight difference between them.

Usual means something that is normal or expected. It refers to something that happens regularly or frequently. For example, if you say "It's usual for me to have cereal for breakfast," you are saying that you typically eat cereal for breakfast.

Typical describes something that is common or representative of a group, while usual describes something that is normal or expected.

quotes.Text: I can't wait to get on stage, because there you don't worry about whether you'll ever get married because your life is insane, or whether you'll ever have another boyfriend again, you don't worry about the typical boundaries of how your life has to be.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Florence Welch

quotes.Text: I would never suggest anyone to stay at a company more than six or seven years. We grow as individuals and the world is moving so fast. Typically, I'll always sell a piece of each of my companies along the way.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: J. Christopher Burch

quotes.Text: If my life has had a theme, I suppose it has been a typical American theme in that, for most of it, I have been looking for happiness and success.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.Text: Typically, I'm put in high heels and a tight top, which is not my personality at all.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Janet Varney

quotes.Text: I tend to like writing characters that are not typical heroes.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: N. K. Jemisin

quotes.Text: I'm not a typical couturier, although I really respect them.
quotes.Title: Japanese Designer
quotes.Name: Nicola Formichetti

quotes.Text: I long for typical days, but rarely get them any more.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Nora Roberts

quotes.Text: I like action. It's not typical, but it's a passion.
quotes.Title: South Korean Director
quotes.Name: Jennifer Yuh Nelson

quotes.Text: I typically take life one day at a time.
quotes.Name: Aviva

quotes.Text: My life is anything but typical.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Margaret Cho
